reviews.text:
Great service on a Sunday in the summer (May to September ish)with an hourly service to and from Bristol temple meads (winter timetable when they assume no one wants to go there but that is another storey at a cost of £3 return!!  The journey takes about 35 minutes

Weekday & Saturday  services are more frequent to Avonmouth with a train every two hours - to allow a more frequent service with unfortunately no bus from Avonmouth to Severn beach which was withdrawn (political and money!!)  A bus service does goes to Cribbs which does fill the gaps

The station is literally the end of the line though - and there is plenty to do from there - walking, cycling, pottering, bird watching and a heritage trail

There are no facilities at the station other than a shelter - timetables are available on a poster along with other things to do  There is a help point 

Buy tickets on the train as there is no machine at the station

Really chilled area great for water front walks cycling and beach combing. Lovely place to walk dogs with nature reserve on one side. Avonmouth to the west and lovely views across the estuary towards Wales and the Forest of Dean.
Great service for the local area and the 7.51 to Bristol is always on time every morning. More frequent trains are a necessity, though, which really needs to be fought for.

through bristol to servern beach 5.51am  leaves i 9mins to get to work... for 6, 
5.45am.......... no gd for people working down there
